title: Gurung (1987) (Nepal) Western Genesis Portion
description:
Gurung language (also known as Tamu kyi, or Tamu bhaasaa) is spoken by the Gurung people of Nepal. The total number of all Gurung speakers in Nepal was 227,918 in 1991 and 325,622 in 2011.

Nepal's official language Nepali, is an Indo-European language, whereas Gurung is a Sino-Tibetan language. Gurung is one of the major languages of Nepal and is also spoken in Bhutan, and by diaspora communities in other countries such as Singapore and Hong Kong.

language.name: Gurung
language.area: Gandaki zone, Kaski, Syangja districts; Dhaulagiri zone, Parbat District. Possibly in Myanmar. Also in Bhutan, India.
